thread.title: Yoenis Cespedes needs more time before Mets return
thread.title_full: Yoenis Cespedes needs more time before Mets return | New York Post

author: Mike Puma
title: Yoenis Cespedes needs more time before Mets return
text:
Yoenis Cespedes sat out the Mets’ workout Friday at Citi Field while continuing to recover from a shoulder injury, with four days left until the dawn of the team’s first World Series in 15 years.
The team’s most dangerous power hitter (non-Daniel Murphy category) did not receive a cortisone shot until Thursday, one day after leaving the Mets’ NLCS clincher in the second inning due to left shoulder soreness. He is expected at Saturday’s full-squad workout.
Roughly half the team was on hand for Friday’s voluntary session. Position player regulars Lucas Duda, Travis d’Arnaud, Michael Conforto and Wilmer Flores made appearances, as did starting pitchers Jacob deGrom and Steven Matz.
Juan Uribe, who was not on the Mets roster for either of the first two rounds of the playoffs due to a chest injury, took grounders and is scheduled to take batting practice Saturday. Still, manager Terry Collins seemed reluctant to place the 36-year-old on the 25-man roster for the World Series following a nearly month-long layoff.
